page.title: 01The Land around Loch Nell
page.content: The Loch Nell - Glen Lonan area is agriculturally bassen, being mainly composed of rough hill grazing supporting sheep and cattle. Parts are boggy & the moorland covered with heathes, bracken, myrtle, mosses & coarse grasses. A freshwater loch is fed by hill streams, and contains salmon and sea trout. There are a few small farms an some modern bungalows to the south of the area, several being only 'Holiday' homes. Rooms and caravans are let to summer visitors: ponies are kept for trekking. A single-track road with 'Passing Places' undulates across the area. There are some deciduous trees-oak, ash, older, birch & Rowan. Tree-felling & Re-Planting is carried out among the pine forests. In early summer the roadsides are beautiful with wild irises, dog roses & Foxglove
